document_title: Data for characterization of SALK_084889, a T-DNA insertion line of Arabidopsis thaliana
summary_full: This article characterizes the T-DNA insertion line SALK_084889 in Arabidopsis thaliana. T-DNA insertions were identified in the 3′ UTR of DREB2A and the promoter of LOX1. Quantitative real-time PCR (qPCR) was used to analyze the expression levels of DREB2A and LOX1 in SALK_084889 compared to wild-type (Col) plants. Drought and heat tolerance were also assessed. The data indicate that DREB2A expression is affected in roots under drought, while LOX1 is significantly downregulated in both roots and shoots under all tested conditions. These findings provide valuable data for understanding the roles of DREB2A and LOX1 in plant stress responses.
key_findings: T-DNA insertion sites were precisely identified in the 3′ UTR of DREB2A and the promoter of LOX1 in the SALK_084889 Arabidopsis line.
DREB2A expression is not downregulated under normal conditions but is affected in roots during drought treatment in SALK_084889.
LOX1 expression is significantly downregulated in both roots and shoots of SALK_084889 under all tested conditions.
SALK_084889 exhibits altered tolerance to drought and heat stress compared to wild-type Col plants.
future_research_fields: Further investigation into the specific molecular mechanisms by which T-DNA insertion in the LOX1 promoter affects its expression.
Detailed analysis of the role of DREB2A in root-specific drought response in Arabidopsis.
Exploration of the combined effects of DREB2A and LOX1 mutations on plant stress tolerance.
Utilizing SALK_084889 as a resource for studying lipid peroxidation pathways and their regulation under stress.

conclusions: The characterization of the SALK_084889 T-DNA insertion line confirms insertions in the DREB2A and LOX1 genes, leading to altered expression patterns and differential responses to drought and heat stress. These findings provide a valuable resource for further genetic studies on stress tolerance mechanisms in Arabidopsis.
impact_statement: This study provides precise genetic characterization of a T-DNA insertion line, offering a crucial resource for understanding plant stress response pathways involving DREB2A and LOX1.
